snippet: A team of mathematicians and engineers has calculated that if taxi riders were willing to share a cab, New York City could reduce the current fleet of 13,500 taxis up to 40 percent.
abstract: Team of mathematicians and engineers publish study in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finding that New York City could reduce taxi fleet of 13,500 by 40 percent if riders were willing to share cabs; report that change could unclog traffic, conserve fuel and fight air pollution.

byline.original: By KENNETH CHANG and JOSHUA A. KRISCH
